<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d9dcb64.1503">   <title>Vacancy for PhD candidate and a postdoctoral fellow on the project Object Matters: Archaeology and Heritage in the 21th century </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d9dcb64.1503</link>   <description> A PhD candidate and a postdoctoral fellow (both three-year) in contemporary<br>archaeology is now announced at the Department of archaeology and social<br>anthropology, UiT- The Arctic University of Norway. The two positions are<br>affiliated with the new research project *Object Matters: Archaeology and<br>Heritage in the 21th century*. See full descriptions and contact details in<br>the links below [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T17:22:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rodney Harrison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d9dcb64.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;b7762fc.1503">   <title>TOC & CFP, J. African Diaspora Archaeology & Heritage </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;b7762fc.1503</link>   <description> Journal of African Diaspora Archaeology and Heritage<br>Vol. 4, Issue 1, March 2015<br><br>This issue is now available online at:<br>http://www.maneyonline.com/toc/jaf/4/1<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Indians of African Descent<br>Special Collection, edited by Shihan De Silva Jayasuriya<br><br>Table of Contents<br><br>Indians of African Descent: Emerging Roles and New Identities<br>By Shihan De Silva Jayasuriya<br>J. of African Diaspora Archaeology &amp; Heritage, Vol. 4, No. 1: 1-18.<br>http://www.maneyonline.com/doi/abs/10.1179/2161944114Z.00000000019 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T23:53:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christopher C. Fennell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;b7762fc.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6353c19c.1503">   <title>Gender and Heritage: Performance, Place and Politics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6353c19c.1503</link>   <description> Gender and Heritage: Performance, Place and Politics<br>Key Issues in Cultural Heritage (Routledge).<br>Edited by Wera Grahn (Link\ufffd\ufffdping University) and Ross Wilson (University of Chichester)<br><br>Call for abstracts \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Deadline March 15 2015<br><br>The editors invite abstracts for inclusion in a landmark edited collection on gender and heritage studies which will form part of the Routledge series Key Issues in Cultural Heritage (Series Editors: Professor William Logan and Professor Laurajane Smith). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:30:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ross Wilson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6353c19c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;12949bd7.1503">   <title>Re: Archaeology Technician Post </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;12949bd7.1503</link>   <description> An Archaeology Technician post is going at the University of Aberdeen<br><br>&quot;The School of Geosciences has a vacancy for a Geosciences Technician to provide support to its expanding teaching and research programmes. Based predominantly within St Mary's you will principally be providing wide-ranging services to Archaeology and Palaeoecology, with additional input across the School and College as necessary&quot;. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:16:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver, Jeff</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;12949bd7.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1c1dc1d9.1502">   <title>UCL Institute of Archaeology seminar, 2/3/2015 - Island of the Dragons: money and the archaeology of the Square Mile (Paul Graves-Brown) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1c1dc1d9.1502</link>   <description> Hello all,<br><br>This Monday (2/3/15) at 4pm, Paul Graves-Brown&lt;http://www.ucl.ac.uk/archaeology/people/staff/honorary/graves-brown&gt; will give the seventh lecture in the UCL Institute of Archaeology seminar series, Future Pasts | Present Futures. Paul's talk is entitled 'Island of the Dragons: money and the archaeology of the Square Mile'. This talk will present a new and fascinating exploration of the City of London, one of the most mysterious places still to linger in the heart of capital. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T11:14:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gardner, Jonathan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1c1dc1d9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f820f3de.1502">   <title>a three-year Postdoctoral Researcher Position in Oulu, Finland </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f820f3de.1502</link>   <description> Tutkijatohtori, bioantropologian tutkimusryhm\ufffd\ufffd<br>The Faculty of Humanities of the University of Oulu, Finland, announces a three-year Postdoctoral Researcher Position in bioarcheological research community to start at the beginning of May, 2015.<br><br>Description<br>Bioarchaeological research community (BARC) at University of Oulu, Finland, is looking for a talented and research-oriented postdoctoral researcher. This position is for three years. The postdoctoral researcher is expected to make a contribution to multidisciplinary research of this research community by bringing in expertise in at least one of its areas of research. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T12:28:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Timo Ylimaunu</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f820f3de.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e99c572a.1502">   <title>CHAT 2015: Together. Call for Papers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e99c572a.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>The 13th Annual Conference of the Contemporary and Historical Archaeology<br>in Theory (CHAT) Group will be hosted by the University of Sheffield, and<br>will run from 30th October to 1 November 2015.<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdTogether\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is inspired by Richard Sennett\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds book of the same name, in which<br>he examines the sociology of co-operation, and specifically the skills of<br>living and working together. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-20T17:38:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Toby Pillatt</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e99c572a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;2046a06.1502">   <title>spikey phenomenon </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;2046a06.1502</link>   <description> Interesting article in today\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Guardian on the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdanti-homeless spikes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd that are becoming part of modern urban architecture and, presumably, future archaeology. http://www.theguardian.com/society/2015/feb/18/defensive-architecture-keeps-poverty-undeen-and-makes-us-more-hostile<br>(According to the url, they keep poverty \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdundeen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Good old Grauniad).<br>David   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T15:21:11-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Gordon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;2046a06.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;380df31.1502">   <title>2015 European Industrial Heritage Year </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;380df31.1502</link>   <description> 2015... the European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year.<br>... An idea once launched by volunteers and voluntary associations now becomes reality !<br><br>INVITATION TO JOIN THE KICK-OFF MEETING IN BRUSSELS: MARCH 6th<br><br>In every European country the &quot;European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year&quot; is developing faster and broader than we - and many others - did or even ever could expect.<br>Everywhere initiatives are launched bottom-up by volunteers and associations. Activities and events are scheduled by grassroots organizations.<br>Many thanks to all those who now are now devoting themselves to turn the "European Industrial and Technical Heritage Year" into a [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T17:46:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Adriaan Linters</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;380df31.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;59f6746c.1502">   <title>UCL Institute of Archaeology event - Demolition and Salvage Times, Hilary Powell, 23rd February </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;59f6746c.1502</link>   <description> Hello all,<br><br>This Monday (23/2/15) at 4pm, Hilary Powell, Leverhulme Artist in Residence at UCL Chemistry, will give the 6th seminar of UCL Institute of Archaeology's 2015 series, entitled 'Demolition and Salvage Times'.<br>This may be of interest to many on the CHAT list and all are welcome to attend. The seminars take place every Monday 4-6pm in the Institute on the 6th Floor in room 612 and are followed by a wine reception. Also at the reception we will be hosting an IoA Journals Evening, including the launch of Papers form Institute of Archaeology vol. 24 (online, open-access here<http://www.pia-journal.co.uk/issue/view/26>) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T16:32:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gardner, Jonathan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;59f6746c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;70997a64.1502">   <title>Snibston </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;70997a64.1502</link>   <description> Looks like Snibston museum is going to close: http://www.museumsassociation.org/museums-journal/news/15012014-council-approves-closure-snibston-discovery-museum<br><br>Snibston showcases Leicestershire's science, technology and design collections, including major innovations in transport and engineering history.<br><br>David    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T13:52:40-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Gordon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;70997a64.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;36f52be7.1502">   <title>Plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;36f52be7.1502</link>   <description> I am not aware of a specific recording method for plastics. They tend to<br>occur as foam core insulation material under concrete slabs or as various<br>conduits and drains often associated with plastic warning tape. We take the<br>latter very seriously indeed even if we have been assured that there are no<br>live services on the site (famous last words). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T09:54:36+11:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Iain Stuart</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;36f52be7.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f66b8652.1502">   <title>Last Call for Papers-Session "Heritage in transition", NorthAmericaTAG, May 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f66b8652.1502</link>   <description> Please could you post this as a reminder of a last call. Thanks in advance.<br><br>------ Apologies for cross-posting ------<br><br>*CALL FOR PAPERS*<br><br>*North American TAG 2015 Conference &quot;MOVEMENT&quot;*<br><br>May 22-24, 2015. New York University, New York City.<br><br>https://wp.nyu.edu/gsas-nyutag2015/<br><br>We are still accepting titles and abstracts for individual papers and<br>presentations ---- *DEADLINE 28 February 2015.*<br><br>*Session: HERITAGE in TRANSITION* [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T15:49:08+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>laia colomer i solsona</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f66b8652.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;4295de50.1502">   <title>Re: plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;4295de50.1502</link>   <description> There was an ?English Heritage project monitoring the impact of ploughing using plastics included in trenches &amp; possibly pseudo arch features a few years back (2005?). Monitored by Oxford Archaeology &amp; including a geoarch component. Carl Champness the man to talk to there<br><br>Sent from my iSeren<br><br>&gt; On 11 Feb 2015, at 16:55, &quot;gabriel moshenska&quot; &lt;gmoshenska@YAHOO.CO.UK&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>> Digging a school playing field in Norfolk many years back we found lots of discarded ice-pop wrappers. We tried to date the layers from the prices - ranging from 1d to 2p to 5p to 10p - based on our [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T18:50:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>seren griffiths</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;4295de50.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;ac5c5a93.1502">   <title>Re: plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;ac5c5a93.1502</link>   <description> Digging a school playing field in Norfolk many years back we found lots of discarded ice-pop wrappers. We tried to date the layers from the prices - ranging from 1d to 2p to 5p to 10p - based on our own recollections, but the contexts were a bit too disturbed to get a clear sequence.<br>Gabe\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T16:50:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>gabriel moshenska</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;ac5c5a93.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1d8d663d.1502">   <title>Re: plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1d8d663d.1502</link>   <description> Hi Matt,<br><br>A small time capsule wrapped in a plastic bag left by Colin Renfrew's diggers in a small cleft in the rock in the 1973 trench across the ditch at the Ring of Brodgar helped establish the original cut for the ditch when it was reopened in 2008 (the capsule also contained a mars bar wrapper among other things). I suppose this is an inclusion of sorts. It was displayed and is held in the Orkney Museum. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T16:17:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1d8d663d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;cdf7aeda.1502">   <title>Re: plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;cdf7aeda.1502</link>   <description> Hey Matt,<br><br>We had an artifact code for plastic in UMASS's excavations in Deerfield<br>village. Plastic sheeting was a particularly good diagnostic marker for<br>the late 20t century, as much of the village museum was constantly under<br>renovation and plastic sheeting was used in the restoration process.<br><br>We weren't systematic or typological about it--so we didn't break down<br>bakelites or other early plastics from later industrial plastic. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T10:59:18-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Quentin Lewis</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;cdf7aeda.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1a3948ce.1502">   <title>plastics as stratigraphic markers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1a3948ce.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm interested in plastics as inclusions in archaeological deposits in the ground. Does anyone know of any excavations where the recording of plastic artefacts and materials or plastic-bearing layers was important from a stratigraphic point of view? Are there any plans, sections, photos or context sheets that might illustrate this? Or do we tend not to record such recent deposits in detail? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T15:40:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Matt Edgeworth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;1a3948ce.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;293c4051.1502">   <title>Papa Westray Heritage Ranger post </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;293c4051.1502</link>   <description> New Heritage Ranger post on Papa Westray, Orkney, being advertised now:<br><br>http://www.papawestray.co.uk/heritageranger.html\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Cheers,<br>Dan<br><br>Daniel Lee<br>Project Officer/Field Teaching Officer<br>Orkney Research Centre for Archaeology (ORCA)<br>Archaeology Institute<br>Orkney College<br>University of the Highlands and Islands<br>Kirkwall<br>Orkney<br>KW15 1LX<br><br>01856 569214<br><br>http://www.uhi.ac.uk/en/archaeology-institute   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:08:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;293c4051.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e789c13.1502">   <title>SPMA Grants </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e789c13.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>A quick reminder that the deadline for the SPMA Research Grant (max \ufffd\ufffd1500) and the new Community Engagement Award (max \ufffd\ufffd500) is March 1st. For further details please see the Society's website.<br><br>http://www.spma.org.uk/prizes-and-grants/community-award/<br><br>Hilary   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T09:48:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hilary Orange</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;e789c13.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;5c94195a.1502">   <title>Re: Future of cities: a visual history of the future </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;5c94195a.1502</link>   <description> Laura Watts did some interesting work on Future Archaeology in the mobile telecommunications industry, and has also worked with the renewable industry in Orkney which is situated in rural/'marginal' places. There are links to some of her papers here, including a neat description of what future archaeology is:<br><br>http://www.sand14.com/futurearch/whatis.htm<br><br>Cheers,<br>Dan<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Discussion List for Contemporary and Historical Archaeology [mailto:CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Sarah May<br>Sent: 06 February 2015 10:16<br>To: CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Future of cities: a visual history of the future [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T13:42:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Daniel Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;5c94195a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d267fcc.1502">   <title>Fwd: CFP: EAA 2015 Session: Dark Heritage </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d267fcc.1502</link>   <description> ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: *Susannah Eckersley* &lt;Susannah.Eckersley@newcastle.ac.uk&gt;<br>Date: Friday, 6 February 2015<br>Subject: CFP: EAA 2015 Session: Dark Heritage<br>To: HERITAGE@jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>please can I ask you to share this call for papers widely in your networks.<br>We are interested in contributions from all those working on the material<br>culture and heritage of internment and forced wartime migration, in<br>addition to archaeologists. The deadline for submissions is 16th February.<br>Full details available from the link below the session abstract. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-07T06:11:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rodney Harrison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;3d267fcc.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;edaae744.1502">   <title>Re: Future of cities: a visual history of the future </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;edaae744.1502</link>   <description> Of course there's this, but I don't think its been given a decent shot yet<br><br>http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/petr-kropotkin-fields-factories-and-workshops-or-industry-combined-with-agriculture-and-brain-w<br><br>S<br><br>On 6 Feb 2015, at 10:13, Paul Graves-Brown &lt;slightlymuddy@gmail.com&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Well in a sense I suppose you'd want to say that garden cities aimed to be both?<br>&gt;<br>&gt; P<br>&gt;<br>&gt; On 06/02/2015 09:44, Sarah May wrote:<br>&gt;&gt; Thanks Paul,<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; very pretty, and interesting to see that it comes from the .gov.uk site, direct funding. pp. 231-235 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T11:53:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rodney Harrison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;ec2507e9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;81688696.1502">   <title>UCL Institute of Archaeology event - Boyle Family, World Series: Monday 9th February 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;81688696.1502</link>   <description> Hello all,<br><br>This Monday (9/2/15) Boyle Family&lt;http://www.boylefamily.co.uk/index.html&gt; will give the 5th seminar of UCL Institute of Archaeology's 2015 series, titled 'World Series'<br>This may be of interest to many on the CHAT list and all are welcome to attend. The seminars take place every Monday 4-6pm in the Institute on the 6th Floor in room 612 and are followed by a wine reception. Please see the link below for a full list of upcoming seminars. Posters are available on request if you wish to publicise the event further. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T16:14:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gardner, Jonathan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;81688696.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f028f1c1.1502">   <title>EAA sessions of potential interest </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f028f1c1.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>APOLOGIES FOR CROSS-POSTING<br><br>Some sessions that may be of interest to historical / contemporary archaeologists planning to attend EAA in Glasgow, September 2015. Please note the CFP is open until 16 February:<br><br>MARGINAL ARCHAEOLOGIES / ARCHAEOLOGIES OF MARGINS<br>This broad, interdisciplinary session will examine different aspects of marginality in the archaeological record and the various approaches that have been developed to tackle it. Marginality can manifest itself in many ways that are salient to studies from the deepest past to the present day, from interpretative to scientific perspectives. The session aims to widen conversations that often take place [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T12:37:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hilary Orange</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;f028f1c1.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6333d47b.1502">   <title>'Excavating Buried Memories: Mnemonic Production in the Railways Under London and Berlin' wins 2014 Peter Lang Young Scholars Competition in Memory Studies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6333d47b.1502</link>   <description> *With apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Peter Lang Oxford is delighted to announce the winner of the 2014 Peter Lang Young Scholars Competition in Memory Studies:<br><br>WINNER<br>Dr Samuel Merrill<br><br>Excavating Buried Memories:<br>Mnemonic Production in the Railways Under London and Berlin<br><br>We are also pleased to announce the runner-up in the competition:<br><br>RUNNER-UP<br>Dr Alice Wittgenstein<br><br>In the Presence of the Past?:<br>'Third Generation' Germans and the Cultural Memory of National Socialism and the Holocaust [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T11:16:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Laurel Plapp</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CONTEMP-HIST-ARCH;6333d47b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
